required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Community-Based Kiosks for Hearing Screening and Education
clinical_study.official_title: Community-Based Kiosks for Hearing Screening and Education

brief_summary.textblock: The overall goal of the project is to evaluate innovative, cost-effective, community-based automated hearing screening and education methods to motivate individuals with mild-to-moderate hearing loss to enter the hearing healthcare system.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Screening

primary_outcome.measure: Record number of participants who sought hearing healthcare 6 months after the initial visit.

secondary_outcome.measure: Record number of participants whose attitude about hearing health care has changed 6 months after the initial visit.

other_outcome.measure: Record which hearing screening method was best at motivating subjects to pursue hearing healthcare.

arm_group.description: Subjects will take an abbreviated automated hearing test and then receive recommendations for hearing healthcare follow-up.
Subjects will take a pure-tone hearing screening test and then receive recommendations for hearing healthcare follow-up.
Subjects will take a digits-in-noise test and then receive recommendations for hearing healthcare follow-up.
This group of subjects will not receive a screening test.

intervention.description: Subjects will watch a brief animated video that shows how hearing works, take a self-administered hearing screening test, watch a hearing loss counseling video, listen to a demonstration of amplified sounds, and receive printed recommendations for hearing healthcare follow-up. All subjects will complete the Hearing Handicap Inventory for Adults (HHIA) questionnaire and the Hearing Beliefs Questionnaire (HBQ). Approximately 6 months after their initial appointment, subjects in this groups will receive a telephone call and will be asked questions related to their actions and attitudes related to hearing and hearing health care.

During the test different tones are going to be presented at one volume level. Participants will identify whether or not they heard the tone. All subjects will complete the Hearing Handicap Inventory for Adults (HHIA) questionnaire and the Hearing Beliefs Questionnaire (HBQ). Approximately 6 months after their initial appointment, subjects in this groups will receive a telephone call and will be asked questions related to their actions and attitudes related to hearing and hearing health care.

During the test subjects will hear a pattern of 3 numbers with variable noise in the background and identify the pattern they hear. All subjects will complete the Hearing Handicap Inventory for Adults (HHIA) questionnaire and the Hearing Beliefs Questionnaire (HBQ). Approximately 6 months after their initial appointment, subjects in this groups will receive a telephone call and will be asked questions related to their actions and attitudes related to hearing and hearing health care.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria: :
- Some subjects will have a complaint of hearing difficulty without a recent hearing evaluation
Exclusion Criteria:
- For all groups: minimum age 18 years. No current hearing aid use

overall_official.affiliation: Portland VA Medical Center, National Center for Rehabilitative Auditory Research

facility.name: Portland VA Medical Center, National Center for Rehabilitative Auditory Research
